Question
========

According to Hadley, a "concise, and fun, way to summarise the main differences [between tibbles and data.frames] is that tibbles are [[1]] and [[2]]: they do less and complain more."

Which ordered pair of words replaces [[1]] and [[2]] to best complete the sentence?

Answerlist
----------

* lazy, surly
* chunky, lazy
* surly, handsome
* compact, efficient
* poor, nasty
* brutish, short

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* Correct. 
* No, they're not "chunky".
* No, they're not "handsome".
* No, they're not really compact or efficient.
* No, that was the first part of Hobbes' description of the [life of mankind](https://yalebooksblog.co.uk/2013/04/05/thomas-hobbes-solitary-poor-nasty-brutish-and-short/)
* No, that was the second part of Hobbes' description of the [life of mankind](https://yalebooksblog.co.uk/2013/04/05/thomas-hobbes-solitary-poor-nasty-brutish-and-short/)
